snippet: An Americana dealer has found a photo album that he says has a connection to President Obama’s maternal ancestors in Kansas and Ohio.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Americana dealer Ian Brabner will bring a 19th-century album, which may contain photos of Pres Barack Obama's relatives, to the New York Antiquarian Book Fair; wooden desks made by freed slave Willie Howard in the 1870s will be on display at the Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art in Hartford and the Minneapolis Institute of Arts; Swann Auction Galleries will sell letters of Revolutionary War leaders from the collection of Allyn Kellogg Ford.
lead_paragraph: An Americana dealer has found a photo album that he says has a connection to President Obama’s maternal ancestors in Kansas and Ohio.

headline.seo: At Antiquarian Book Fair, Photos of Obama Ancestors
headline.main: Album Might Have a Presidential Tie
headline.print_headline: Album Might Have a Presidential Tie
